intro: Hallea, commonly known as the red hallea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Hallea has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers that attract pollinators like birds and insects. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
